bibl.title: The Categorization of Numeric and Magical Texts as Exemplified by OMM 170 + 796 + 844.
Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008.

bibl.note: Categorization of texts and the establishment of textual classifications: textual sorts and genres. - Observations on categories of texts from Medînet Mâdi [pp. 180-181: Table 1: Categories of Ostraca from Medînet Mâdi]. - The series OMM [= O. Medinet Madi Inv.] 170 + 796 + 844 [edd.: Franziska Naether & Micah Ross, Interlude: A Series Containing a Hemerology with Lengths of Daylight, EVO 31 (2008) pp. 59-90, 1 pl.]. - Numeric texts [see in part. pp. 201-202: Greek numeric genres]. - Numbers in religious, ritual, magical and divinatory texts. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: Franziska Naether & Micah Ross, The Categorization of Numeric and Magical Texts as Exemplified by OMM 170 + 796 + 844.

Mark Depauw & Yanne Broux (edd.), Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 231 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 165-206, 1 tabl., 1 fig.

Categorization of texts and the establishment of textual classifications: textual sorts and genres. - Observations on categories of texts from Medînet Mâdi [pp. 180-181: Table 1: Categories of Ostraca from Medînet Mâdi]. - The series OMM [= O. Medinet Madi Inv.] 170 + 796 + 844 [edd.: Franziska Naether & Micah Ross, Interlude: A Series Containing a Hemerology with Lengths of Daylight, EVO 31 (2008) pp. 59-90, 1 pl.]. - Numeric texts [see in part. pp. 201-202: Greek numeric genres]. - Numbers in religious, ritual, magical and divinatory texts. - Conclusion.
